meanings.definition: A radioactive isotope of carbon, especially carbon-14.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use radiocarbons to study ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist analyzed the radiocarbons found in the fossil.
meanings.sent3: The radiocarbons in the lab were feeling a bit too energetic today.
meanings.sent4: The radiocarbons in the atmosphere danced with cosmic rays.
meanings.sent5: The radiocarbons glowed softly in the dark, revealing their presence.

meanings.definition: The process of measuring the amount of radiocarbons in a sample to determine its age.
meanings.sent1: Carbon dating relies on analyzing radiocarbons in ancient remains.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used radiocarbons to estimate the age of the fossil.
meanings.sent3: The radiocarbons in the test tube were eager to reveal their secrets.
meanings.sent4: The radiocarbons whispered the age of the artifact to the researcher.
meanings.sent5: The radiocarbons held the key to unlocking the past within their atomic structure.
